item.title: [+1733] Stewart: FOX Failed To Mention Co-Owner Is One They Accuse O
item.description: Jon Stewart continued his coverage of the "Ground Zero Mosque" debate last night, focusing on Fox News' incongruities harder than he ever has. In a segment called "The Parent Company Trap," Stewart shared with his viewers how Fox News' plan to "follow the money" from mosque builder Imam Rauf to terrorists will be

[+1164] Dashcam Captures Scary 100 MPH Car Crash (Video)
item.description: A car tears down the middle of a highway and disintegrates on impact with the underpass. It was captured on camera by a guy whose other home videos now seem even more boring.

item.title: [+889] True Love
[+874] The Crises of Capitalism (Animated)
item.description: In this short RSA Animate, radical sociologist David Harvey asks if it is time to look beyond capitalism, towards a new social order that would allow us to live within a system that could be responsible, just and humane.

item.title: [+814] Driver's Test (PIC)
item.description: I'm not saying I agree with this...but...

item.title: [+790] Why are 20-somethings taking so long to grow up?
item.description: It’s happening all over, in all sorts of families, not just young people moving back home but also young people taking longer to reach adulthood overall. It’s a development that predates the current economic doldrums, and no one knows yet what the impact will be. Getting to what we would call adulthood is happening later than ever. But why?

item.title: [+739] The 15 Biggest Box Office Bombs
item.description: What makes a movie a box office "bomb "? Just losing money doesn't make it qualify. It's the amount of loss from the production costs to ticket receipts that makes the difference. For example, 2006’s Zyzzyx Road took in a shocking $30 at the box office, but since it cost only $1 million to make, it didn't lose enough money.

item.title: [+724] Isaiah Mustafa: Before He Was The Old Spice Guy
item.description: Isaiah Mustafa wears many hats. And they all smell better than your hats.

item.title: [+632] Hitler descended from Jews & Africans he hated...DNA claims
item.description: Brussels news magazine Knack reported that DNA obtained from Hitler's relatives living in America led to this discovery.

item.title: [+618] Bill Murray - The "Greatest Smartass" Ever!
item.description: He's been in some of the funniest movies of all time. He's a living legend. He seems like he'd be a cool dude to hang out with. But you already knew that.

item.title: [+609] Valve's 'Portal' Mandatory 'Reading' for College Freshmen
item.description: We've dug our heels in as decidedly pro when it comes to the debate over whether or not video games are art. And, although we're not desperate for additional support, our argument has gotten a serious boost from Wabash College in Indiana.

item.title: [+589] 20 Strangest Sex Laws from Around the World (Infographic)
item.description: Not all sex-related laws make sense. Here’s a collection of 20 of the weirdest sex laws from around the world.

item.title: [+530] New Solar System Discovered
item.description: European astronomers on Tuesday said they had found a distant star orbited by at least five planets in the biggest discovery of so-called exoplanets since the first was logged 15 years ago. One of the planets is nearly the mass of Earth.

item.title: [+513] Why Intel bought McAfee
item.description: Theories abound for why Intel bought McAfee, but the reality is more prosaic than most imagine. The Aurora attacks on Google and others were a wakeup call for Intel, and the company got serious about developing vPro's security potential. But to do that, they had to be able to offer products and services directly to the consumer.
